reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Cap Juluca from 8/3-8/9. When we pulled up at the front lobby Juliette greeted us enthusiastically and warmly. We then proceeded into the lobby where we got our first glimpse of the Cap Juluca beach. I literally gasped when I saw it and was choked up by the sheer beauty of it. I have never, and doubt that I will ever, see a beach this gorgeous. White sand and breathtaking turquoise water; words cannot describe, you have to see it yourself. Reception was quick and friendly. We were offered the option of either rum punch or regular fruit punch. We opted for the rum punch and it was delicious. We were told our room wasn’t ready yet because check-in was at 3, but we had come from another hotel on the island where check-out was at noon, so we were early. We went to lunch at Blue and had another cocktail while dining there and waiting for our room to be ready. We were greeted so warmly even at the restaurant, we enjoyed the food, and the service was prompt and courteous. When our room was ready, the staff at Blue informed us. We were then shown to our oceanfront one bedroom suite and could not have been happier. It was situated on the ground floor, had two verandas, two bathrooms, two flat screen TVs, and the master bath with a solarium was lovely. We immediately unpacked and headed to the beach, which was literally a five second walk from our room. When we returned from the beach there was a complementary bottle of champagne chilling for us with a note welcoming us to Cap Juluca and thanking us for choosing the resort for our stay in Anguilla. I thought that this was a very nice touch and was so pleased. This bottle of champagne went for $155 on the room service menu. Our first night, we received a call from management again thanking us for choosing Cap Juluca, asking us if we were happy with our accommodations and if there was anything we needed. We also had a complementary minibar that we were told would be replenished at a charge, but it was so well stocked that it wasn’t necessary to have it restocked. It included sodas, beer and water. Water was replenished twice daily by housekeeping and was free of charge.
reviews.title: Stunning beach, perfect stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can’t say enough good things about the beach at Cap Juluca. We felt as if we were on our own private beach because the beach chairs were so aptly spaced. The water was calm and perfectly tempered. The service on the beach was impeccable. There were beach chairs set up for us every day when we arrived. After the first day, the beach attendants seemed to know when we would arrive. So they had our chairs and umbrella set up and waiting for us. Within minutes of arriving at the beach, they would bring us our cooler with water and ask if we needed anything else. We often had cocktails and would use our flag if we wanted another. Everett was one of the beach attendants and was so personable and helpful. Around 3 o’clock every day, someone came around with delicious sorbet for a snack. I loved this and looked forward to it daily. We always stayed on the beach until it was time to go in and get ready for dinner. You can find some beautiful shells on the beach here, but I recommend purchasing some goggles from the gift shop if you want to find some larger conch shells, they are just beyond the surf. I found so many!
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast at Blue was fabulous and so was the room service breakfast, we did both an equal number of times. There was nice selection of breakfast food and it was all delicious.
reviews.title: Perfect in Every Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to dinner at Pimms once and we had a table right in the front overlooking the ocean. On the night we dined there, someone had proposed at a private beach dinner at the resort and had fireworks set off for their bride to be. So that was a pretty exciting and scenic dinner. The food was good and the service great. I recommend going to Veya at least one night while staying in Anguilla, the food was delectable. Straw Hat is also a good choice for dinner and a relaxed atmosphere
reviews.title: Second visit...those promised renovations never came!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spice is great for cocktails after dinner and we went there most nights. The staff at Spice were amazing (namely Jessica), very friendly and made sure we were taken care of at all times.
reviews.title: Place to go before you die

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not going to mention the beach and how it's the most beautiful one on the island, with it's white sand and crystal blue waters. I'm not even going to talk about the rooms and how they are incredibly spacious and comfortable. I'm also not talking about the magic in the air and how you will never have a better night's sleep thanks to the sounds of the waves right outside your terrace door.
reviews.title: Unnn-Believable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What I will talk about, is what makes all of the above that much more special, and that's the Staff!!! They are hands down the most incredibly friendly, warm, sincere, group of people I have ever encountered. With that said, I'd like to personally thank:

reviews.title: Love this place, we always stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and to EVERYONE who I have not mentioned by name...THANK YOU for your unbeatable, genuine, assistance!
reviews.title: Nice beach, nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first visit was for our honeymoon in May 2005. It was definitely a magical experience and while we certainly were on a high from just getting married, we were overwhelmed by the views, the service and the experience of being able to relax oceanside. This is place where you can enjoy a private retreat or meet fellow honeymooners if you want. The service was great and Pimms is delicious. When we returned 5 years later we were pleased with the room improvements and the new Maundays Bay lounge. Our second trip we did with another couple and reserved a dinner in the private wine room at Pimms. One of the most memorable dinners ever!
reviews.title: Been twice - always beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things started off pretty nice at Cap Juluca: when we arrived we got a delicious rum cocktail, a double room upgrade, and a bottle of champagne waiting for us in the room. We got a second floor room so we had a beautiful view of the beach and St. Maarten. The room was nice and big, huge closet, comfy bed and spacious bathroom. We had a solarium which is a nice touch for anyone who wants to sunbath nude (it's not allowed on any of the beaches, I believe). The bathroom fixtures could use a little upgrading. They were cheap and old both in the rooms and in the public areas.
reviews.title: Great beach, but rooms and service could be improved

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We tried all the restaurants on the property: Pimms, Spice and Blue. They were all mediocre at best. For those prices you can get much better food (and service) elsewhere on the island - with better views. The continental breakfast was very disappointing. Pastries were not very good. They are the kind of pastries you would find at a 7-11 or other low grade supermarket. There's an omelet station but that's not very good either. Coffee and tea selection is not that great either. This breakfast is complimentary so I guess you get what you pay for...
reviews.title: Wanted to LOVE...but there were a few bumps.

reviews.text: The good parts: the beach is by far the best beach in Anguilla. Cap Juluca has the whole stretch to themselves so there's lots of room and lots of privacy. Very quiet and relaxing. The beach chairs are very comfy and in good shape. They give you fresh towels and replenish your cooler with complimentary water bottles throughout the day. At 3pm they give out delicious sorbets which were the highlight of our day. At 4pm, you can go to the main building and get tea, coffee, scones and cookies, which were also delicious.
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service was all over the place. Some people were really friendly and helpful and went out of their way to accommodate. Others seemed resentful to be employed at CJ. We consulted the concierge a few times. Sometimes she was helpful, at other times she tried to dissuade us from venturing off the property. When I asked her for recommendations for lunch outside of CJ she suggested we order sandwiches from room service.
reviews.title: Where do I begin? With this...STAY HERE!

description: Insulated from the outside world, yet only minutes by air or motor launch from St. Maarten, Cap Juluca resort is a private self-contained enclave along two miles of the best pristine white-sand beaches in the Caribbean. Spacious Moorish villas, five-star restaurants, exotic landscaped tropical gardens, and friendly and abundant service professionals provide an unparalleled level of luxury. Cap Juluca features a comprehensive array of entertainment amenities, including a fully equipped fitness center, private golf carts andbicycles, aqua golf driving range, bunker and putting green, croquet lawn, Junior Olympic-size swimming pool, a library, tennis courts with a full-time resident pro, and water sports, including snorkeling, wind surfing, water skiing, and sailing.
